Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Completion of ACG2021, ACG2701, ECO2013, ECO2023, QMB 3003 (or MAC2233 and STA2023), and CGS2100C with a grade of "C" or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Students learn to apply critical transferable, career-enhancing skills including team work, leadership, conflict resolution, ethics, motivation, negotiation, and written and oral communication.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Provides a basic understanding of the importance of career professionalism in today's competitive business environment. The course focuses on personal branding/marketing and career search strategies.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Coaches provide recommendations throughout the career search process, and help implement the career plan developed during the previous three career development courses.

GEB3006 - Introduction to Career Develop.name: GEB3006 - Introduction to Career Development and Financial Plannings

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Course covers: (1) career development with applications for UCF majors and regional labor market, (2) personal finance topics related to education and life-long financial planning.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Admission to the College of Business.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Designed to provide a basic understanding of the importance of career professionalism in today's competitive business environment. The course focuses on self-awareness and career research and planning.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Introduction to the U.S. business system and the role it plays in a global economy.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Admission to the Integrated Business major.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Students will learn how to plan, open and manage a small business. Topics include franchising, family businesses, buying a business, and independent contracting.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Completion of ACG2021, ACG2701, ECO2013, ECO2023, ECO3401 (or MAC2233 and STA2023), and CGS2100C with a grade of "C" or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Focuses on a firm's ability to recognize, evaluate and integrate technological developments to create value, solve problems, and gain competitive advantages.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Develops each student's ability to make a persuasive one-on-one or small group presentation, that is designed to invoke action by either the individual or small group.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Admission to the Integrated Business major.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Using public and private data to make informed business decisions. Includes issue identification, feasible solution generation, optimal decision selection, performance tracking, and persuasive writing.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Finance major, Junior standing and admission to CBA.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Focuses on providing an understanding of the concepts and skills required for international negotiations and transactions.

GEB3031L - Cornerstone Lab: Professional.name: GEB3031L - Cornerstone Lab: Professional Skills for Business

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Students apply concepts and principles introduced in GEB 3031 and related skills essential to academic and professional success.

GEB4934 - Current Topics in Business Adm.name: GEB4934 - Current Topics in Business Administration

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Admission to the College of Business, and C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Guest lectures discussing current topics that impact business in the Central Florida, state, national, and international business environments.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: College of Business Administration Dean's Office

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Admission to the Integrated Business BSBA major

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examines the impact of external environmental changes on industries and individual businesses. Follows the PESTEL framework, considering political, economic, socio-cultural, technological, environmental, and legal forces.

GEB3375H - Honors Introduction to Intern.name: GEB3375H - Honors Introduction to International Business

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Junior standing, permission of Honors, ACG 2071, ECO 2013, and ECO 2023, each with a "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Understanding the interdependence of globalized world economy and similarities between domestic and international business domains. Same as GEB 3375 with honors level content.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Ethical foundations of business and the relationship between markets and morality through a comparative analysis of capitalist and socialist ideals.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Junior standing and ACG 2071, ECO 2013 and ECO 2023, each with a "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Understanding the interdependence of globalized world economy and similarities between domestic and international business domains.
